title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1107.16 - Suspensions and denials of program or course approval
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1107.16 - Suspensions and denials of program or course approval

State Regulations
(a) Within 60 days after the receipt of the
application for approval of a course of study, the department shall inform the
sponsor as to whether it has been approved, denied, or whether additional
information is needed to determine acceptability. The department may deny, suspend, or revoke the approval of a real estate appraiser course of study, instructor, or location, if it is determined not to be in compliance with law
and regulations, or if the offering does not adequately reflect and present
current real estate knowledge. (b) If disciplinary action is taken, a written order of suspension, revocation or
denial of approval shall be issued. Appeal thereof may be made to the Secretary
of State or designee. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
